website_summaries.verdict: This strong and sturdy stainless steel auger is suitable for earth drilling, helping gardeners with deep root feeding.
pros: This strong and durable auger blade is ideal for drilling into soil
Can be attached to an electric or cordless drill with the end fitting
cons: Buyers report this blade can be quick to dull

customer_reviews.title: If you have your own beach umbrella, you need this!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for drilling holes in the sand to put your umbrella deep enough not to blow away. I saw the hotel and condo personnel using these to quickly set up lines of chairs and umbrellas and decided to get one for my own chairs and umbrella. It works great with a cordless drill.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred B. Jernigan Jr.

customer_reviews.title: The ground was pretty dry & hard
customer_reviews.text: We had our yard completely renovated and, as part of this, we had a lot of new things to plant. The ground was pretty dry & hard, so digging large holes was not an easy task. So I bought this auger, and attached it to a cordless drill. It was the easiest thing in the world to use that to break up the earth - drill down, to about 24"; remove the auger by reversing the drill; repeat the process a couple of inches away. The soil was easy to dig up after that. The auger is very solidly-built. Even after recent use, it still looks as-new. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: SDR

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: It's way better than I thought. So here's the thing for everyone complaining it doesn't hold to your drill chuck. It's designed that way just like any spade or drill bit that is not rated for impact. If it was squares it has a high possibility of breaking your drill chuck teeth of worse burning your motor. As you can see it bored through rock, at the expense of a lot of battery power but it did it, just wanted to prove it could. I have a 20v DeWalt. And yes I used it to put up an entire fence, not for plants. 5 holes to every pole and the dirt comes up easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help me dig holes in my backyard. The soil is clay like if you get below 12". Also wanted to try for installing wood poles. I am using with a hammer drill. Results so far have been good. I was able to quickly dig a post hole - I was going slow and careful because I didn't want to hit a sprinkler pipe or drain pipe (like I usually do with a shovel) - maybe works good at slow speed (with a hammer drill). I also made a hole for a Jasmine vine in the same area, no problems there. Your results may vary, but I'd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AKC

customer_reviews.title: ... planted 140 bulbs yesterday (daffodils) and it held up nicely. Total time spent was about 1
customer_reviews.text: I planted 140 bulbs yesterday (daffodils) and it held up nicely. Total time spent was about 1.5 hours. Would have taken days and broke my back and knees without this tool. Highly recommended, but you will need a powerful corded, not cordless, drill if you have hard ground. We waited until after a full week of rain to soften up the soil, and it was still hard. We have very hard clay-based soil so this was a tough test for this tool and it held up. I expected it to break as a result, but was surprised it lasted. Probably will plant some more because it was so easy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Good Tree Root Feeder
customer_reviews.text: Auger Sharpens easily for faster cutting in earth through smaller roots. Works great for fertilizing trees in spring and fall. The 1 3/4" X 24" bore allows sufficeint fertilizer to be deposited below the grass line where the tree roots absorb for typical six month tree feeding.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: Beach umbrellas and tents.. Put em up and they stay up.
customer_reviews.text: As others have said.. Perfect for Beach Umbrellas. Set up 3 umbrellas every time we go and it's a snap. I also helped my brother in law put his tent on the beach by drilling the 4 holes for the legs. The item in the image is the exact same item I received. I do wish it had flattened ends for the drill to grip on but it doesn't seem to effect the ability of the auger. Price is 1/3 of the "Professional" one that many of the beach umbrella websites sell. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JerzeyJ

customer_reviews.title: Surpassed my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: Going into this, my expectations for this product were low. Not so much because of the product, but the ground I intended to use the auger in. The soil we have has limited amount of dirt on top, followed by thick, heavy and wet clay. In certain areas, there are small and large rocks mixed in. After digging several post holes 2'-3' deep, this auger was huge in saving me time. Once in awhile the auger would slip in the drill due to the clay. After awhile I found a good method that worked well. Not sure on its longevity, but so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: I Like Bacon

customer_reviews.title: Like Butter Baby!
customer_reviews.text: We used this auger to dig holes for solar powered stake lights. It dug through the ground like it was butter, and we have some pretty hard ground including areas that have a five inch base of compacted decomposed granite. Of course the auger is longer than we needed for this purpose, but my husband measured eight inches up from the tip and wound some painters tape around the auger so he knew when to stop digging. I thought that was pretty clever. Next we will use it to dig holes for flower bulubs.
customer_reviews.author: KWPR

customer_reviews.title: Order this because it will save you time.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to plant bulbs and bare root seedlings. It is perfect for that application. I have planted over 100 trees with it so far and the only issue I have had is when I hit a large rock or a root. I have used it in mulch, heavy clay/gravel, wet soil, dry soil and flower beds. It has worked flawlessly. I wish I had ordered this years ago and could have saved myself a lot of time over the years. I can now plant bulbs in seconds as oppose to minutes. Could also be used for onions, potatoes, tulips, or any other bulb or tuber planting.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Need to grind three (3) flats for drill chuck for this auger to work properly
customer_reviews.text: Auger worked when flats (see photo) were added for drill chuck to grab. Watch out - you will need a drill with a side handle or this auger will twist your wrist (and hurt). AND Yes it does have a tendency to bend a little but the rod is soft and easily reshaped by hand. Yes I would buy again - but has to be modified - again see my photo. Dom - Bloomington Springs TN
customer_reviews.author: H. J. Dominik

customer_reviews.title: I filed the metal to provide angles for a better bite from the drill
customer_reviews.text: My yard is a mix of sand and clay. This bit is not hardened steel. No matter how tight the bit, on hard enough ground it will spin and remove metal within the bit clamp of the drill. I filed the metal to provide angles for a better bite from the drill. The steel is too soft. It just ground off in tough ground - now back to round again and loosing diameter fast.
customer_reviews.author: City Dweller-Country Heart

customer_reviews.title: Great beach tool!
customer_reviews.text: Use for beach umbrella. Love it!! Husband thought it would be too heavy to carry this and a drill, but it worked out great. This is how the lifeguards do it on some beaches. I alone carried my chair, beach bag and wooden lifeguard grade umbrella to beach. I’m a petite lady. Used with a black and decker cordless drill (try one in the store first and get a lightweight one). I can see many uses for this; can use on the garden etc. I wish it came with a canvas carrying bag since I’m using it at the beach, but I can make one pretty easy I think.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Coates

customer_reviews.title: and in fact better than I had expected
customer_reviews.text: I used this soil auger to drill pilot holes for steel fence posts. Before using the auger, I welded a single half inch bead along the round shank to prevent slipping in the drill chuck. With a powerful drill, one must be careful to back off the power when the auger bites into especially hard soil, pebbles, etc. to avoid twisting out of your grip. The auger flute is welded onto the shank at three points. I preemptively welded a few other spots, but that may not be necessary. The result is that this soil auger works quickly, and in fact better than I had expected.
customer_reviews.author: Cainiac

customer_reviews.title: Saves a Lot of Time
customer_reviews.text: This auger is easy to use, and fits well into and easy to use with my 20V DeWalt cordless drill. I have used it in a hard black clay soil to place metal Tiki torches in the ground as well as to get a larger hole started planting a shrub by drilling several holes in the circumference I was trying to attain. This is much better than trying to force something down hard clay or prewatering it to loosen it up.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Good Investment
customer_reviews.text: We go to the beach all the time. The plastic handles on umbrellas are apt to break, and because it's always windy at the beach, the wind can pull it out of the sand if it's not properly secured. This auger is long so I can drill deep into the hard sand if I need to, or sometimes I do it because I want the umbrella lower. Either way, it stays secured in the sand and saves time (and embarrassment if the wind pulls it out and it goes flying) I'm very happy that I got this auger. It's an excellent addition to our beach gear.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Tougher than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I am using it to dig next to my foundation. I can easily snub out a 120v ac 1/2” drill. My drill has a keyed chuck and I made sure it was really tight. I used it straight for about two hours and it held up just fine. Again, I made sure the chuck was as tight as I could get it and it never slipped the whole time. I may get another to weld to the first so I can go deeper
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Round shaft head stripped in drill. NOT a hex bit head.
customer_reviews.text: This has been a help when it doesn't just spin in the drill chuck. Even tightened with high "Gorilla" torque, this is so long / big for a hand drill it really needs a HEX head not Round. Slightly damaged my drill too. My advise is make the head with flat or hex head or buy one that already is made with the Hex head.
customer_reviews.author: kindleuser

customer_reviews.title: Needs a flat side to keep it in the drill
customer_reviews.text: This works when you drill into soft soil, but the bit end needs a flat side to make it stay in the drill better.
customer_reviews.author: SwordCat

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money Not only was this designed badly, but it bends. I was very surprised when I received this product that the end of the shaft was round. There was no way to tighten the drill chuck enough to keep the auger from spinning when there was torque. I am lucky I have someone to weld on something to make the thing work.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Stern

customer_reviews.title: It tends to bind up and then slip out of the drill
customer_reviews.text: Works great except that it slips out of the drill every time you hit a difficult spot. I like it other than the inconvenience. Bottom line: it works best in soft, well tilled soil. If your soil doesn't meet that criterion, you might be frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: KimoKailua

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this auger for a purpose it was not designed for - drilling deep holes. I have under the top soil something called "hard pan", and that is accurate when it is really dry you have to use a pick ax. I need to install post for an electric fence and I could not drive them into the hard pan. The auger went right on thru the full length of the auger, and I was only use a battery powered 3/8" drill motor.
customer_reviews.author: Edward T. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: rounded shaft keeps slipping
customer_reviews.text: Why is this an "Amazon's Choice" product??? Usually that is reliable guide, but not this time! Every few seconds the auger slips from my DeWalt cordless drill, no matter how tight I tighten the chuck. Returning this thing and replacing it with an auger with a hex-head.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Finley

customer_reviews.title: You’re going to want this
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap. Use this for the beach!!!!! I read reviews and wanted it to plant umbrellas(4)in the sand while at the beach and it WORKS FREAKING AWESOME. I felt like the smartest guy on the sand and have had a million people ask me about already. I’ve made up my money in free beer setting other folks umbrellas around us already. Don’t worry about bit being rounded. It doesn’t cause a problem at all. Also works well in Georgia clay. Serious game changer. All 4 umbrellas can go up in less than a minute. No more busting ass to screw in base!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's U.S. made, believe it or not.
customer_reviews.text: Looks like it's working like it should. I mainly got this to bore out the pipes for target frames at the local rifle range. No problem with sand and dirt but if it hits rocks or other hard debris you better back it off. Over all I'm a satisfied customer. Hey, it's U.S. made also. This is one tool every home owner needs.
customer_reviews.author: limj

customer_reviews.title: Great earth mover for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Work great for drilling cores in compacted soil in my yard. Needs a heavy duty drill if you're not in sandy soil. Only complaint is that the auger tip that the drill chuck clamps on broke off for me one. Fortunately only a small pice of the auger rod tip broke off in the drill, and I was able to use the remaining rod easily.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Not a 1 3/4 inch auger
customer_reviews.text: This is a 1 1/2 inch auger, I have no idea why it is mislabeled. Even if it drills a larger hole than it's actual size, which one can easily do with many augers in many soils, it should not be mislabeled in this way. Sturdy enough.
customer_reviews.author: WillfromNO

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Auger
customer_reviews.text: Used this auger on my husband's drill this spring to drill holes in the ground around many of our smaller trees to fertilize them. This auger has held up very well and got the job done. Recommend and satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah & Tom Jones

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: This a great tool to have if you dig a lot of holes. I post signs for the company I work for and this works great! I just wish I would have purchased it years ago!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rhon

customer_reviews.title: Great in Sand - Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for what we needed. I used it to drill holes in the sand at the beach to hold my10x10 pop-up tent. This worked great. The feet were a little bigger than the auger created, but I was able to work the drill around to create the size we needed. I haven't planted any bulbs or anything with it yet, but I plan to in the spring. I used a 19.2-volt​ drill and it powered it nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Y.

customer_reviews.title: Great for planting
customer_reviews.text: The local big box hardware store only had one size. So glad that I could go to Amazon and get type of Auger that I needed. This one was perfect for planting when using my cordless drill.
customer_reviews.author: Go Seahawks!

customer_reviews.title: Practice safe umbrella control!
customer_reviews.text: The wind can be very strong here on the beach. This auger drills a nice deep hole quickly and our umbrella never moves. You need to pull it out and shake of the sand a couple of times, don't try to make your hole in one shot.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Guillette

customer_reviews.title: i wouldnt buy again
customer_reviews.text: not very durable didnt drll to easily seems cheaply made weak metal
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Downgraded slightly as the bit tends to get stuck (nearby tree roots, maybe?) and then needs to be manually unwound from the soil. Not a showstopper, but a bit of an annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Puntin

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I used this in pretty hard clay soil and it worked very well. Since the shaft is round and smooth where theydrill chuck needs to grab, I used my grinder to flatten areas to make it grip better. So far I have drilled about a hundred holes for fertilizer and it has held up. I took a star off because I had to grind the shaft.
customer_reviews.author: John Stebbins

customer_reviews.title: Worked very well, except...
customer_reviews.text: The shaft is smooth and round, so there was a tendency to spin in the drill chuck under load. If the shaft would have been notched to hinder spin, I would have give 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Weir

customer_reviews.title: They did work.
customer_reviews.text: For the price point I was expecting a little better quality. They did work and our soil is hard and full of small rocks but they would have lasted a bit longer with more than three tack welds. If you have Rocky soil plan on these being disposable.
customer_reviews.author: Jess H.

customer_reviews.title: Shakes Like An Earth Quake
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put PVC pipe In the ground for a cellphone antenna, It works good but should only be used with a larger reversible drill It, a smaller drill would Not have the power for It and would tear It up.........
customer_reviews.author: S. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Not great for hard ground.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well, but we have hard ground so it only lasted one day. When the bit got stuck it would start slipping in my drill which ended up tearing up the bit and eventually was unable to use it.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: digs through the hardest, clay dirt!
customer_reviews.text: My husband used this to dig 20-inch holes to get some drainage for our trees. Worked better than I thought it would.
customer_reviews.author: D. Neill

customer_reviews.title: Good quality auger with a big caveat.
customer_reviews.text: This otherwise well made auger for drilling holes in the ground comes with a big caveat. The top of the spiral blade had a sharp corner that could lacerate your hand if it came in contact with the auger while it was turning in the drill. I was about to return it but decided to use a file to round off the edge, making it a lot safer.
customer_reviews.author: Andyrvws

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beach umbrellas.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for beach trips. Just attach the auger to your cordless drill, drill a hole in the sand, and screw the umbrella base in. Saves time and provides a more secure anchor for your umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: Lexacocca

customer_reviews.title: US Made and Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a simple augur to allow us to sink 1" PVC pipes into the ground to hold up a simple fence. This American Made device works perfectly for that task. I love simple solutions to problems and I especially like that it US made.
customer_reviews.author: GerryR

customer_reviews.title: Best for beach umbrellas
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to use this at the beach digging beach umbrellas. It was a hit of the beach trip this year. We have a big family gathering at the beach every year and set up 6 to 8 umbrellas in the morning. This thing cut the set up time into nothing. It takes maybe 30 seconds to dig and set up your umbrella. This is a must for every trip moving forward.
customer_reviews.author: Honest JIM

customer_reviews.title: poor design
customer_reviews.text: The part that goes into drill is round and made of soft steel. So it spins and eat up the steel as soon as it hits real material to sugar through. To drill into anything but maybe sand, you need a squared off surface with a steel that will hold and not slip - one designed for a drill chuck to grab and not spin. It was extremely poor design for its purpose and size. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works as expected
customer_reviews.text: works great to drill holes in the beach for an umbrella or rod holder
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Henline

customer_reviews.title: Works great and was a good price
customer_reviews.text: Works great and was a good price - Only reason I did not give a 5 was because it struggles with hard ground...I would totally give a 4.5 on this though
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Wagner

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Slips out if the drill. There are no notches to grasp the rod in the drill.
customer_reviews.author: Doberdog

customer_reviews.title: Auger bit works great with my drill
customer_reviews.text: Auger bit works great with my drill. The ground around my home is slightly clay filled and this bit with my drill worked flawlessly. Took this thing to the beach to drill a pilot hole for our beach umbrella. It literally took like 15 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Works great. This thing is tough
customer_reviews.text: Works great. This thing is tough. No issues even in heavy clay soil. Better have a good drill, though. This auger works great, but definitely hard on the drill
customer_reviews.author: happyhikingdad

customer_reviews.title: Drill 'n' Drop
customer_reviews.text: If you don't like getting up and down off the ground and plant as many bulbs as I do, you'll want this tool. Stand up, bend slightly, drill 'n' drop. People driving by will rubberneck, I think that they're just jealous!
customer_reviews.author: JimmyN

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought with the purpose of using at the beach for an umbrella “hole”. Worked like a charm, other people were admiring it as we drilled the hole. Saved us time and a back ache.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer, Clancy

customer_reviews.title: If you had dry hard ground this wouldn't work but it was perfect for my springtime lawn under the trees to put ...
customer_reviews.text: lawn was moist and grandson and I did 20 holes in about 15 minutes, 8" to 10" deep, I just used my Skil 12 volt drill rather than the large corded one. If you had dry hard ground this wouldn't work but it was perfect for my springtime lawn under the trees to put in fertilizer spikes.
customer_reviews.author: do

customer_reviews.title: Used it for 70 t-posts
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't have had a chance without this tool. I used the auger to drill a 2 foot pilot hole in rocky soil before banging in the t-posts. It saved me a lot of time by avoiding locations the post would have otherwise hit rock.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Does the job intended
customer_reviews.text: Overall good product ,could be improved with shaft end squared to eliminate slippage in Chuck.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Wright

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: Worked well! I wish they made one twice as long!
customer_reviews.author: Rich H

customer_reviews.title: Just make sure you have a good, charged drill
customer_reviews.text: Used it for soil sampling in very hard ground that hadn't had a rain for a month but needed a few 16 inch deep Nitrogen samples. Just make sure you have a good, charged drill. Mine didn't die on me, but I could see that it would use up your battery rather fast. Drilling at an angle into the soil helps too. Like it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Fertilizer Spikes
customer_reviews.text: No more worries about broken/crumbled tree and bush fertilizer spikes. Quick and easy installation with just about any electric drill. Reasonable quality for price.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Ray

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t like it won’t buy again
customer_reviews.text: This thing is no good used it with my fri and it keeps ungripping since it’s plain at the shaft I would not recommend this
customer_reviews.author: Mario Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Works better than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: I had no trouble at all drilling a series of holes into our yard for sulphur and iron for our oak tree. Our soil is dense fine clay, and this went in without any trouble at all. I used a Ryobi cordless drill, set for low speed & high torque.
customer_reviews.author: Dale B.

customer_reviews.title: For my compost
customer_reviews.text: Used this to churn my compost. Perfect for loosening the material to increase air flow or turning with a fork. Works quickly. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Busher is Now!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tool. Used for drilling holes in sand for beach umbrellas
customer_reviews.author: matt turbeville

customer_reviews.title: Better than I thought, but...
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool for digging into clay hardpan, but because it's got a smooth, round shank it rotates in the chuck and has to be tightened constantly.
customer_reviews.author: peg marson

customer_reviews.title: Great Bit!
customer_reviews.text: This auger is well made and works well with a 3/8 drill. This product does what you need it to do in drilling holes in dense sand or packed soil.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Rubino

customer_reviews.title: Dang hardpan soil! This did not work in my ...
customer_reviews.text: Dang hardpan soil! This did not work in my yard, but I am sure it would with "normal" soil. I mean, we dug a foot-deep hole and filled it with water to test for drainage, and the water stayed in the hole for more than a week. Most of it evaporated and did not sink into the soil.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size
customer_reviews.text: This auger is mistakenly labeled 1 3/4” when it in fact is closer to 1 7/16”, and why I returned the 1 3/4” tube I bought with it.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Does the job and more!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I bought this a long time ago! Good for clearing gopher holes. Good for creating the deep holes for the vibrating acoustic gopher/mole repellers.
customer_reviews.author: RodC

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed...
customer_reviews.text: This auger is exactly what I needed to fertilize my recently pruned oak trees.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Git r done
customer_reviews.text: End of Shaft could be flatten to lock in drill better
customer_reviews.author: KnollAdmin

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Did what it promised. Can’t speak to slipping in drill due to shape as it didn’t for me but can understand if digging through tough soil. Overall good product and the length I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifully. Took less than 5 minutes to have it ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to bore a hole in the sand at the beach for my umbrella. Works beautifully. Took less than 5 minutes to have it set up in a deep hole. The large canvas umbrella never wavered!
customer_reviews.author: Reba

customer_reviews.title: Great auger!
customer_reviews.text: Great auger! Fits my battery powered Dewalt. I used this auger to drill through sand, shell and small rocks to install a no-dig fence.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah Arias

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beach umbrellas
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for beach umbrellas. Just add a cordless drill and you're good to go. No more umbrellas flying down the beach. Also, makes it much easier to move when the tide moves in or out.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product around the yard. For more in depth review please go to the YouTube channel called No Filter Reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Pettit

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Did the job with ease. I use it to dig holes at the beach for umbrellas. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Light-duty use only
customer_reviews.text: Only two welds along shaft. I fear that this thing will break under hard usage.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent R.

customer_reviews.title: Worth its weight in gold.
customer_reviews.text: We used this to drill umbrella holes at the beach!
customer_reviews.author: Sharlyn

customer_reviews.title: Great for the beach!
customer_reviews.text: Use it with my cordless power drill when I go to the beach. Great for sinking deep hole for umbrella post. I should have gotten a smaller diameter auger so the post fits tighter but this one works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Boomer Sooner

customer_reviews.title: Very handy tool. I use it with my 1/2" ...
customer_reviews.text: Very handy tool. I use it with my 1/2" drill. Seems to be a quality product and does what it says... drills holes in the ground!
customer_reviews.author: Danni Akers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: good for planting small annuals, and plugging holes for trees that need chem reatment or fert.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: It does the trick!
customer_reviews.text: A high quality, heavy duty bit. I've used it to auger through clay and stony soil. Follow the instructions and be patient to get the best results.
customer_reviews.author: RLM 0710

customer_reviews.title: It works very well with my 3/8 inch drill. ...
customer_reviews.text: It works very well with my 3/8 inch drill. Made short work of drilling fertilizer holes around a small Sycamore tree.
customer_reviews.author: Linda A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Bit strips when using
customer_reviews.text: It’s nice and sturdy. I would give all the stars, however it doesn’t fit well in the drill and it eventually just strips it and keeps spinning sometimes when in use.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Yanez

customer_reviews.title: So glad we purchased
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we needed. Fits onto existing cordless drill. Can dig a hole for beach umbrella in no time at all. So glad we purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs a hex drive
customer_reviews.text: It did the job of drilling holes for sign posts, but would be a much better tool if it had a hex drive. The jaws of my 18V drill's chuck scored the drive at least an 1/8th of an inch.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D. Kimmich

customer_reviews.title: Much better than digging by hand and faster
customer_reviews.text: Made fast work of bulb planting this past fall. The 1-3/4 inch is acceptable for daffodil bulbs but larger bulbs are a snug fit in the angered hole. Used an electric drill. If no underground obstructions, aguring is easy. Auger gets hung up on roots which can cause the drill to fly out of your hand.
customer_reviews.author: L. Rifici

customer_reviews.title: Nice garden tool
customer_reviews.text: This is great for planting or loosening up the soul
customer_reviews.author: P. G. S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice dirt drill
customer_reviews.text: Nice. Especially with a drill that can be reversed if you get hung up. Had no problem with the shaft slipping as others mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Kotcher

customer_reviews.title: Did the job.
customer_reviews.text: Did the job. Bigger would have been better but when you only have 4 posts to put in it sure beat a post hole digger alone.
customer_reviews.author: GmaH in SC

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: It's not what I wanted. But I'm sure I'll get use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Clark

customer_reviews.title: Good in soil with NO rocks
customer_reviews.text: Works very good,,, provided the soil DOES NOT have rocks. I drilled 25 holes and all seems fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Will not follow its own pilot. Wallers around on the ground and eventually beats a large hole.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I needed 18 inch deep holes for plant tree stakes and this auger performed perfect. Just take it slow and let it slip if it gets bound up. This 1 3/4 bit works perfect with tree stakes available at Home Depot that are 1 7/8 -2 inch thick x 8 feet.
customer_reviews.author: RON SCHARINGER

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Love it for the beach when putting up my umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy75

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Did exactly what we wanted. We were able to furtilize our "got the wrong address" mutilated 50-year-old pecans!
customer_reviews.author: BL

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Where was this all.my life...makes sinking garden poles entirely too easy
customer_reviews.author: MPH

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: Put in drill use at beach for pop up canopy love it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beach drill bit
customer_reviews.text: I use it to drill my umbrella hole in the sand at the beach. Works like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: Cagle

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: work good to drill a pilot hole for the beach umbrella
customer_reviews.author: Doug Hartman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but needs electric drill and two handed use as others have noted.
customer_reviews.author: Sammikens
